Module org.example.miniproyecto_3
Package org.example.miniproyecto_3.Model

Class Ship

java.lang.Object
org.example.miniproyecto_3.Model.ShipAdapter
org.example.miniproyecto_3.Model.Ship
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, IShip
public class Ship extends ShipAdapter implements Serializable
Represents a ship in the Battleship game.

Each ship has a specific length, type (e.g., Fragata, Destructor), orientation, and position on the board. It also tracks the coordinates where it has been hit.

See Also:

  • Constructor Details

    • Ship

      public Ship(int length)
      Constructs a ship with the specified length.

      Sets the ship type based on its length:

      • 1 - Fragata
      • 2 - Destructor
      • 3 - Submarino
      • 4 - Portaaviones

      Parameters:
      length - the number of cells this ship occupies; must be positive
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the length is not positive

  • Method Details

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Returns the length of the ship.
      Returns:
      the length of the ship

    • getHits

      public Set<Coordinate> getHits()
      Returns the set of coordinates where the ship has been hit.
      Returns:
      a set of Coordinate objects representing hits

    • isSunk

      public boolean isSunk()
      Indicates whether the ship is sunk.

      A ship is considered sunk when the number of hits equals its length.

      Specified by:
      isSunk in interface IShip
      Overrides:
      isSunk in class ShipAdapter
      Returns:
      true if the ship is sunk; false otherwise

    • hit

      public void hit(Coordinate h)
